answers.answer: Yes, I have pcos also.  My dr said that supposedly there's no increased risk for miscArriage.   Im not sure that I really believe that.   Just try not to stress over it too much.   Good luck.
Thanks for responding I couldn't get into the dr for another month so was just looking for some feedback until I can get there and ask some questions

I also have pcos I'm 8 weeks prego with our first child. We started trying earlier BC we were also told it would either take a while naturally or fertility clinic. Which neither happened we got prego right away. But my Dr told me that their was no risk in miscarriage that if anything where you don't ovulate during your pregnancy it would stop and get better or  heal it completely . I'm not sure if its true but since I've been prego I've not had anymore pain in my ovaries.
Thank you makes me feel better about the whole situation!
I have pcos and I'm pregnant with my second child..my daughter was overdue so the miscarriage thing is nothing to be scared about but you are going to hairy lol

Morning,  I was diagnosed with pcos the year before I got pregnant in November 2012. I was also told that I had too many factors working against me getting pregnant naturally or via a fertility clinic like weight, age (31 at the time), blocked fallopian tube and hormones. Well long story short, God blessed me with a natural good ole fashiin surprise pregnancy in which I delivered a healthy and beautiful baby girl July 2013 and now I'm natyrally pregnant (17.5 weeks) again but this time with a healthy little boy. Whatever you do, just follow your doctors orders, keep up with appointments and stay positive through it all...you'll ve enjoying your bundle of joy soon, so, no need to worry...there are lots of us that share the pcos journey and we've crossed the finish line with the cutest little trophies and you will too.Congratulations on baby and best wishes throughout and beyond your pregnancy....enjoy...you're a mommy :-) :-) :-) !!!
I have pcos too. I hadn't had a period since february and the one before that was a year before. I found out last month that I was pregnant and at my first ultrasound was 11 weeks 3 days

I have pcos as well and am on my 2nd child. No issues with my first (10 years ago) and so far no issues with this one. You might see if your doc will put you on metformin... It greatly decreases preterm labor, chances if developing gestational diabetes, preeclampsia and even miscarriage especially if you are a heavier woman.
@J_ovalle....pcos is polycystic ovarian syndrome...it affects our ovaries, hormones and insulin.

Thank you all I'm 23 years old and it was kinda drepressing when I got dignosed and my dr said I may not be able to have children ..I was very surprised when I found out but very excited ...when I got dignosed I had already been on a diet and been working out and lost over 30 lbs ...Thank you all for your positivity it makes me feel alot better and even more excited about my little bundle of joy =)
My doc said I wouldn't be able to conceive unless I lost weight. Sometimes docs are simply wrong. :) Congrats and enjoy the pregnancy.

I also have pcos been taking medication all my adult life to get pregnant. ...i stopped taking all medication when my brother died in April and started exercising alot, needless to say tomorrow i will be 14 weeks and have no problems thus far...good luck and congrats

question: So im about 5 weeks pregnant and about 6 months ago I was diagnosed with pcos my dr said I would probably have to go to a fertility clinic if I wanted to get pregnant ...well I didnt have to do that but I do know that the miscarriage rate is higher with pcos...just curious if there are any moms out there who also have pcos that could help clear my mind about this
title: pcos
